questions.question: He drinks a lot, ………………………?
questions.description: If the main verb does not have an auxiliary verb, the question tag uses do, does or did.

questions.question: They arrived in the morning, …………………………?
questions.description: If the main verb does not have an auxiliary verb, the question tag uses do, does or did.

questions.question: The water isn’t salty, ……………………………?
questions.description: If the main verb has an auxiliary, it is repeated in the question tag.

questions.question: Mini lives in Singapore, ……………………………..?
questions.description: If the main verb does not have an auxiliary verb, the question tag uses do, does or did.

questions.question: She won the first prize, ………………………….?
questions.description: If the main verb does not have an auxiliary verb, the question tag uses do, does or did.

questions.question: She has no job, …………………………….?
questions.description: A non-negative tag is used after a negative statement.

questions.question: Let’s take some rest, ……………………………..?
questions.description: Shall we is used in tag questions after let's.

questions.question: A few students wrote the answer, ………………………..?
questions.description: A few has a positive meaning and hence a negative tag is used with it.

questions.question: Few people attended the meeting, ……………………………..?
questions.description: Few has a negative meaning. Non-negative tags are used after negative statements.

questions.question: She paid for the drinks, ………………………………..?
questions.description: Negative tags are used after affirmative statements.
